content: sleepyhead socks are knit cuff-down in the round they feature a 3x1 rib on the leg \ no separate cuff\ and top of the foot and a german short-row heel \ feel free to replace with a different one of your choice\ there are a few reasons for this pattern name first of all it is a very easy-to-follow and almost mindless pattern so you can work on it as your bed-time project knitting these in sport-weight yarn rather than the regular fingering-weight makes it easier to see the stitches in the dim evening light \ added benefit the socks work up much faster\ and finally ribbed texture makes them highly elastic so they are extra-comfy and can be worn as loungewear or bed socks if you are looking for the same pattern in fingering-weight yarn click here 1 **size ** one size - this pattern is intended for an average adult female foot **measurements ** * foot circumference 20 - 22 cm \ 8 - 8 7 \ \* * foot length adjustable \* ribbing makes the socks very elastic so they easily fit a large number of shoe sizes - simply regulate it with the length to which you knit the foot **gauge ** 26 sts x 35 row = 10 x 10 cm \ 4 x 4\ in stockinette for more precise result swatch in the round on the same needles you will use for the socks **needles ** 3mm \ us 2 5\ \ or size to get pattern gauge\ in your preferred format of sock needles either 5 dpns long \ 80-100 cm \ 32-40 \ \ circulars for magic loop or short\ ~25 cm \ 9 \ \ circulars etc **yarn ** 100g or 200 m \ 220 yds\ of sport-weight yarn sample was knit out of 2 balls of vovó retrosaria \ 100 % portuguese wool 50 g / 143 m \ 156 yds\ \ **notions ** 3 markers \ 2 can be the same + 1 unique for bor\ tapestry needle scissors tape measure sock blockers \ optional\ in case you are not familiar with some of the techniques additional videos will help you to understand the instructions -
